pullRequest.body:
where the trivial factors have been dropped.

I have the idea of a general approach to dropping trivial terms from a direct sum. However it is too complicated for me to unsorry it and overkill here, so I am leaving it as a comment.

From LeanAPAP

```suggestion
@[simp]
lemma subsingleton_iff {n : ℕ} : Subsingleton (ZMod n) ↔ n = 1 := by
```

I have had bad experiences with simp lemmas rewriting instance assumptions. Even though in this case it's probably pretty safe (I don't see how you would end up with `Subsingleton (ZMod n)` in your context), I would rather not dare it.
Please indicate briefly what it takes to fill in the sorries. Just hard work, or are there prerequisites missing?
Hmmz, are these the best names?

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: Variant of structure theorem of finite abelian groups
